data.content:
_ _
__**Welcome to OE Midweek!**__
We’re excited to have you with us. In the following sections, you'll find relevant information for everything OE Midweek. Please reach out to one of the following if you have any questions.

Welcome to Occasional Excellence,  we're glad you’re here!

**The Officer Team**
> Babylonius - Guild Master
> Jake
> Kojiyama (Kartra)
> Zarantai
> Paoanii (Paninii/Casterdebuff)
> Schlim
> Morgrom
_ _

embeds.title: Trialing with OE Midweek
embeds.description:
Trials aren’t rushed but take at least two full weeks during progression, and more during farm.  We like to take as long as it takes to decide if we are a good fit for each other.  Trials are treated as full members in every way and are allowed to roll on loot and use guild-provided flasks from cauldrons.

If you are looking for feedback on your trial, please reach out to an officer or anyone in the guild of your class/role.  All are more than happy to walk through logs with you and let you know where you might be able to improve your performance. 

Trials are expected to be on the server for the duration of their trial period. This is because the community is very important to us and we want you to be not only part of our raid but part of our wider guild community.  If you have extenuating circumstances that will delay your transfer to Turalyon by a week or more, please reach out.

**Turalyon is our home and it's a small server economically. Consider researching raiding materials costs to see if it is advantageous for you to bring over materials with you.**

embeds.title: The Spreadsheet
embeds.description:
**[Raider Public Raidbook](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1frswwMADqiGDihLRL_DPBkWtUoSl4AAjO_8w5UMfmVU/edit#gid=440221849?usp=sharing)**

This Google Sheets book contains relevant information regarding raider boss needs, raid comps, boss progression rotations, and boss-specific assignments where necessary. Input what bosses you would like to be in for.  You will also find a tab for boss rotations. Raid comp is typically updated a few hours before the raid.  When farming, rotations are based on a combination of comp requirements and loot needs. 

Reach out to any of the officers if you have specific questions.

embeds.title: Required Addons
embeds.description:
WeakAuras is a required addon. WeakAuras will be provided on a boss-by-boss basis in our strategy threads. 

**[Method Raid Tools](https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/method-raid-tools)**
**[RCLootCouncil](https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/rclootcouncil)**
**[RCLootCouncil - GroupGear](https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/rclootcouncil-groupgear)**

embeds.title: Looting Guidelines
embeds.description:
OE Midweek's looting system is LootCouncil. We take every precaution to make sure that loot is distributed in an equitable fashion that gives the most benefit to the *raid team*. Trinkets and Tier often be on a case-by-case basis.

Use notes anywhere you can to give Council a clear idea of how you intend to use the item. Keep non-productive notes to a minimum.
_ _

fields.name: *Armor*
fields.value:
__**Major**__
Any piece of armor that would be an upgrade of 1 tier of item level [Heroic to Mythic].
> In the event of tier pieces, any piece that would result in the completion of a bonus like 2pc or 4pc.

__**Minor**__
Any piece of armor that would be an upgrade of less than 1 tier of item level [Mythic to End-Boss Mythic]
> In the event of tier pieces, any piece that would not result in the completion of a bonus like 1pc or 3pc.
> Any piece of gear that would be a stat 'sidegrade'.

__**Offspec & .Transmog**__
Self-Explanatory

fields.name: *Weapons and Trinkets*
fields.value:
__**Major**__
Main-hand upgrade of 0.5 or more tiers of item level. [Example: 226 to 233]

__**Minor**__
Off-hands, less than 0.5 tier of item level upgrade, or stat side-grades.

__**Offspec & Transmog**__
Self-Explanatory

__**Trinkets**__
Trinkets are evaluated on a case-by-case basis because there is a disparate impact on which trinkets are "good" and whom they are desirable for. Try to follow the above guidelines as closely as possible, but trinket design tier over tier doesn't lend itself to easy systematic looting rules.

embeds.title: Warcraft Logs
embeds.description:
Anyone is able to upload logs for a raid night. We ask that you appropriately label the logs as Public and OE Midweek.

**[Guild](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/guild/id/5536)
[Midweek](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/guild/id/602294)
[Link to join to log to the guild on WCL](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/guild/autojoin/602294/Pk6j4n1d)**

embeds.title: Attendance Policy
embeds.description: We ask that raiders update attendance as far in advance as possible to help prepare for comp. To do so, please post in the #oem-attendance channel of Discord. We are an adult guild and understand that circumstances may result in missing raid last minute.  If this happens, be sure to post in the Attendance channel in Discord AND message Babylonius so that we can adjust comp accordingly.  Note that excessive absences and/or multiple last-minute call-outs may result in removal from the team.

embeds.title: The Alt Code
embeds.description:
**Alts are brought to raid on a case-by-case basis.**
> *Alts are not made equal - different skills, different roles, different applications, different commitments. We have to make decisions in the best interest of the team and our time raiding.* 
**Alts should serve a fundamental purpose for the team.**
> __*Main swaps and re-rolls for comp reasons are one the biggest ways that we can increase the strength of our team when facing new, challenging content. We make exceptions to fulfill these situations where we need to.*__
**We will not guarantee GV tier unlocks for mains and alts simultaneously.**
> *Raid comp Tetris is fun for approximately 2 weeks, and then it's not fun any more. Too often these fights just don't allow for a lot of variability in our class and player comps. If the paradigm of 3/6/9 GV is maintained through SL, the most we will make an effort to accommodate is 3x for main, 3x for alt.*
**Alts cannot be a detriment to the raid - both in Progression and Farm.**
> *We get it, alts are...well... alts for a reason. We don't expect 90+ percentile parses, but we do expect a minimum of Blue-level output performance, high survivability, and upward trajectory of overall performance of your alt. We don't require alts, so if you are going to have one and you're not making the effort, then neither is Leadership.*
**Alts are held to the same standard as your main.**
> *There is really no way around this. Our common commodity is time, don't waste it.*
**Alts are not beyond redemption.**
> *Sometimes, alts come in and just suck. It happens. If you find yourself in a place where your alt is in Alt Jail, give yourself an opportunity to get better at that alt, gather some data, and make your case to Leadership again.*
